description: Early 19th century cluster of strong tropical volcanic eruptions, including the 1809 event of unknown location, and the 1815 Tambora and 1835 Cisugüina eruptions.  Run three ensemble members for at least 50 years to cover the multi-decadal oceanic response and to assess stationarity of post-cluster climate.
keywords: VolMIP, Tier 2, volcano, volcanic forcing, cluster eruption, SO2
long_name: 19th century volcanic cluster initialized from PiControl
rationale: To investigate uncertainty in the multi-decadal climate response to strong volcanic eruptions (focus on long-term climatic implications). To investigate the contribution of volcanic forcing to the climate of the early 19th century, the coldest period in the past 500 years.  To investigate discrepancies between simulated and reconstructed climates of the early 19th century.

requirements.description: Begin in 1809 (early 19th century volcanic eruption of unknown location) and run for a minimum of 50 years.
requirements.label: 1809-1858 50yrs

requirements.description: Emissions of SO2 into the tropical stratosphere to reproduce the volcanic forcing generated by the early 19th century volcanic cluster.  Include the 1809 eruption of unknown location, 1815 Tambora eruption and 1835 Consigüina eruption.
requirements.label: Cluster SO2

requirements.description: Three initialisations from the pre-industrial control made at at least 50 year intervals.
requirements.keywords: initial conditions, initialisation, pre-industrial control, three member
requirements.label: Three pre-industrial initialisations

requirements.description: Use a coupled Atmosphere-Ocean general circulation model
requirements.label: AOGCM Configuration
